intro: Byrsonima onishiana, commonly known as Brazilian plum or tucumã, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, glossy leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces edible fruits that are often used in traditional medicine and cuisine. Its bark and leaves contain compounds with potential medicinal properties. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforests.
